accelerometer_publisher_send_norm.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 from robotic_skin.sensor.lsm6ds3_accel import LSM6DS3_acclerometer
2 from std_msgs.msg import Float32
3 import rospy
4 import rospkg
5 import argparse
6 import math
7 
8 
9 if __name__ == "__main__":
10  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
11  parser.add_argument('--config_file', action="store",
12  dest="config_file", required=True,
13  help="The configuration yaml file name in package's config folder")
14  args = parser.parse_args()
15  ros_robotic_skin_path = rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin')
16  config_file = ros_robotic_skin_path + "/config/" + args.config_file
17  accel = LSM6DS3_acclerometer(config_file)
18  rospy.init_node('talker_%s' % str(accel.config_dict['imu_number']), anonymous=True)
19  pub = rospy.Publisher('/imu_data%s' % str(accel.config_dict['imu_number']) + 'norm', Float32, queue_size=10)
20  r = rospy.Rate(100)
21  norm_float = Float32()
22  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
23  data0_list = accel.read()
24  norm = math.sqrt(data0_list[0]*data0_list[0] +
25  data0_list[1]*data0_list[1] +
26  data0_list[2]*data0_list[2])
27  if norm < 9.81:
28  print("Norm less than 9.81")
29  norm_float.data = norm
30  pub.publish(norm_float)
31  r.sleep()
